  physical_appearance: This is a branched candleholder
 decorated with bright enamel paint. The stem supports five candleholders
 with the middle candleholder higher than the rest. The candleholders are shaped like lotuses. There are floral motifs around the base of the candleholder and around the stem. There are no chips seen.

  sgcool_label_text: This branched holder for candles (called a candelabrum or candelabra) is decorated with bright enamels. The double-baluster stem supports five candleholders shaped like lotuses. Candelabra were made for dining tables in Europe and America. However
 much of the design and decoration of this object is distinctly Chinese.\r\n\r\nThe form of this candelabra was made in copper
 which was then coated with pigments containing ground glass. The object was then fired to create a bright glassy coating. In the 18th century
 this type was production for foreign export in Guangzhou (Canton)
 with the result that the type is often called Canton enamel.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a branched candleholder, decorated with bright enamel paint. The stem supports five candleholders, with the middle candleholder higher than the rest. The candleholders are shaped like lotuses. There are floral motifs around the base of the candleholder and around the stem. There are no chips seen.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Exports Enamel and enameling China History Ming-Qing dynasties, 1368-1912 Motifs Candelabra Qianlong, Emperor of China, 1711-1799
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This branched holder for candles (called a candelabrum or candelabra) is decorated with bright enamels. The double-baluster stem supports five candleholders shaped like lotuses. Candelabra were made for dining tables in Europe and America. However, much of the design and decoration of this object is distinctly Chinese.

The form of this candelabra was made in copper, which was then coated with pigments containing ground glass. The object was then fired to create a bright glassy coating. In the 18th century, this type was production for foreign export in Guangzhou (Canton), with the result that the type is often called Canton enamel.
